reviewText: Recently on a windy, rainy Midwest night, we sat down with our Alaska Husky Avu to watch this movie. The President and First Lady of the United States lose their dear dogand wonder how to get him back, without a big media circus.Enter a little boy in a foster home far away trying to find someone to love him.Such a story could get sickly sentimental in many movies, but not in this gem. Avu liked it just as much as we did, and she often ignores our favorite flicks.It is well done and draws you in to a story that feels good. Forget about a the fanciful plot twists. This movie will bring a few tears to your eyes, and if you have a dog to pet, all for the better.If you do not, it may prompt you to check with the local dog rescue facility and maybe wind up with a very special addition to your home.  We promise!!Earl and Chris and Avu
summary: A film for dog people and dogs

reviewText: So many of the "moral" movies with all the 5 star ratings are way over rated, usually because story and especially acting are so poor.  This story of an orphan in a foster home,who faces some serious issues about losing people you love, right and wrong, strangers, knowing who to trust...not those that say "trust me"...but those whose actions prove they are worthy to be trusted.Even so the movie doesn't come off as preachy, or try to force feed you beliefs.The movie's script is far-fetched, in that a child finds the President's dog in California and no one will believe him that this IS the President's dog; so the boy decides to take the dog home to the President. BUT the acting is VERY good...even the dog, and the story sticks together, and gives a nice resolution, so that you don't feel left hanging. The first half of the movie the script was drama/adventure, then about half way through, you can see the film adding an attempt at being a comedy for a younger audience with "men in black" and "bad guy situations" that are not of the same caliber as the rest of the movie...but not so out of sync that you become distracted from the goals of the movie, and feeling entertained when the movie is over.
summary: Good acting, good story, good morals. Enjoyable for children and adults.

reviewText: I am an older person with no children and still have a kids heart.  JUST DO THE RIGHT THING is the theme of this movie and guides the young lad down a long road.  He learns a lot but does the right thing getting a wonderful life change.  The movie is predictable but thank goodness.  I hate Sad movies and the somewhat predictable parts make this movie sweet.  The ending is even better than the reconciliation of man and dog.

reviewText: Wonderful and entertaining family film with a boy showing initiative and ability to overcome antagonist challenges.Based on a true story with the Reagan's, it has everything a family film needs, good child actors, suspense, cute dog, and thoughtful messaging while not boring.The filming and production was supported by students as part of a learning environment via SAFE, Sobrato Arts Foundation for Education.
summary: Fun Family Movie - Sobrato Arts Foundation children helped to make the film!
